title: So why does windwall block an unlimited amount of abilities,but poppy's w only works once per champ?
body:
I remember riot saying something the sort of "we don't want the counterplay to an ability which blocks projectiles to just throw projectiles at it until it breaks",yet for poppy's w(which lasts 2.5 seconds,unlike yasuo's windwall which lasts 4) they placed an exception on purpose,which allows people to deal with an ability which stops dashes...by throwing more dashes at it?
How does that make any sense?

*Note:this IS NOT about buffing poppy,because not only do I not believe she needs buffs,this is relevant to only a handful of champions:{{champion:103}} {{champion:84}}  {{champion:429}}{{champion:7}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:58}}   and can situationally(but for the most part,not in a very meaningful way) affect the following:{{champion:150}}{{champion:67}}  {{champion:121}} {{champion:18}}{{champion:76}}  ,and does so in a very specific scenario,making it mean very little for her power level overall.

*Another note,not sure how {{champion:92}} is affected by poppy's w,I'm also not sure how {{champion:131}}  ult works if a dash is blocked(if it goes on cooldown,then she's unaffected by this),they may be in the first group,{{champion:412}} also might be in the first group,depending on who he is paired with.

It may be worth noting that A WHOLE FUCKING LOT of these champions are deeply "loved" by the community,so maybe this is once again them playing favorites? and they are willing to forsake their balancing philosophies once again in their favor?

>this is more about how riot treats certain champions with favoritism,and then takes a completely different approach when the champion is not in bed with them,

It's a completely different ability than Yasuo's wind wall. 

-Dashes =/= projectiles. 

-Windwall is just a projectile block. Steadfast presence gives MS and tank stats in addition to blocking dashes.

-SF deals damage when it blocks dashes. Windwall doesn't. 

-Poppy can move while using SF. Windwall is stationary.

-SF effects a circle around Poppy. Yasuo's is a line.

-Poppy is a completely different champion than Yasuo. Even if the abilities were similar (which they aren't in any meaningful way), they shouldn't necessarily follow the same rules. 

For the record, I think Yasuo is pretty annoying and don't like playing against him. But your argument is based on a comparison that just doesn't make any sense. The only parallels between Wind Wall and SF is that they both block stuff.

This isn't an example of "favoritism". These two abilities have literally no reason to be compared to one another, you're just doing whatever rhetorical gymnastics you have to to somehow make two abilities that have absolutely nothing in common other than that they block things seem comparable so you can push this incredibly contrived point that somehow it means that Riot is "playing favorites" towards a champion you don't like.

I could just as easily say "wtf how come morgana's black shield _breaks_ after it takes a certain amount of damage?!? But it only blocks magic damage and CC, how come Fiora gets to block an unlimited amount of  all types of damage and CC? Riot is clearly playing favorites!!!" and it would be just as credible an argument.

It's not favoritism: many champions have many skillshots; few champions have more than one dash. Blocking that single dash means saving yourself/your ally and/or killing the enemy champion. Mobility is something really important and dashes have way more value than skillshots.
